perturbation.original_text: This amendment to Section 2 (titled "Term"), Part B of the Co-Branding Agreement is made effective December 9, 1996 by and between PC Quote, Inc. (hereinafter referred to as "PCQ") and A.B. Watley, Inc. (hereinafter referred to as "ABW"), who are also the parties contracted in the aforementioned Co-Branding Agreement. This Amendment shall apply to said PCQ and ABW and all of their subsidiaries and related companies.
perturbation.changed_text: This amendment to Section 2 (titled "Term"), Part B of the Co-Branding Agreement is made effective December 9, 1996 by and between PC Quote, Inc. (hereinafter referred to as "PCQ", which for the purpose of this section refers only to the parent company) and A.B. Watley, Inc. (hereinafter referred to as "ABW"), who are also the parties contracted in the aforementioned Co-Branding Agreement. This Amendment shall apply to said PCQ and ABW and all of their subsidiaries and related companies.
perturbation.explanation: The added text introduces a conflicting definition of 'PCQ'. Initially, PCQ includes subsidiaries. The modified text now limits PCQ to only the parent company for Section 2, creating confusion about which entities are bound by this specific section compared to other sections.

perturbation.original_text: This Amendment shall apply to said PCQ and ABW and all of their subsidiaries and related companies.
perturbation.changed_text: This Amendment shall apply to said PCQ and ABW and all of their subsidiaries and related companies only if the Board of Directors of each respective company approve such application.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states the amendment applies to PCQ, ABW, subsidiaries and related companies without conditions. The modified text adds a condition of Board of Directors approval, creating uncertainty and contradiction about when and if the amendment actually applies to the listed entities.

perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies that Mr. Steven Malin and Mr. Howard Meltzer, in their respective roles, are the signatories. The modified text adds 'or authorized agent' and 'or authorized signatory', which creates ambiguity about whether the agreement is valid if someone other than the named individuals sign. This introduces a contradiction because the agreement explicitly names the signatories in one part but then allows for alternates in another.
